data.name: lblNumberOfItemsPerCategoryResource1.Text
data.value: Number of items from each category:

data.name: ListItemResource25.Text
data.value: Limit to number of days in the past:

data.name: Enable add/edit articles to selected categories.HeaderText
data.value: Enable add/edit articles to selected categories

data.name: Select categories to view articles from.HeaderText
data.value: Select categories to view articles from

data.name: lblNumberOfPager.HelpText
data.value: Set how many pagination links (1, 2, 3, 4...) will be displayed in the pagination between Previous and Next.

data.name: lblNumberOfPosts.HelpText
data.value: Set a number of articles displayed per page.

data.name: lblNumberOfPostsToDisplay.HelpText
data.value: Set the total number of articles to be displayed in the current instance. If the set value is 0, all the articles matching display criteria will be displayed.

data.name: lblOpenInAnotherModule.HelpText
data.value: Here you select an instance of the main news module where article details will be opened. If Current module instance is selected, details will be opened in the current instance. If there is more instances of the main news module on a portal, here you can select the one in which you want to open article details.

data.name: lblOpenInAnotherModule.Text
data.value: Open article details in a selected instance:

data.name: lblRenderAsTable.HelpText
data.value: If this option is not enabled, articles are displayed in a list. If the option is enabled, articles are displayed in an HTML table. In this case, it is possible to set the number of columns and their width. Note: to display articles in multiple columns it is also possible to use the more advanced Multi-article template.

data.name: lblRenderAsTable.Text
data.value: Display article layout as HTML table:

data.name: lblSelectArticleView.HelpText
data.value: Select a type of article display. The article mode displays articles in a classic list of articles, whereas the catalog mode combines the display of categories and articles. The article mode is usually used for blogs, news and similar need for displaying article lists. The catalog mode is commonly used for product catalogs.

data.name: lblShowArticlePaging.HelpText
data.value: Check this option if you wish to enable using pagination.

data.name: lblAproveArticle.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then an article must be approved before displaying.

data.name: lblAproveRating.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then article ratings will be displayed.

data.name: lblAproveUpdatedArticles.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then an article needs to be reapproved after updating.

data.name: lblArticleCommentsTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template for comments. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblArticleCSSStyle.HelpText
data.value: Select a display style for the selected theme.

data.name: lblArticleDetailsTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template. A HTML template is responsible for an article details layout. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblArticleDetailsTheme.HelpText
data.value: Select a theme for article details.

data.name: lblArticleListTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template. A HTML template is responsive for the article list layout. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblAuthorsEditOwnArticles.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then authors can edit only their own articles. Admin users can continue to edit all the articles.

data.name: lblAuthorsEditOwnArticles.Text
data.value: Authors can only edit their own articles:

data.name: lblCategoryDisplay.HelpText
data.value: Select categories whose articles will be displayed. If the option ‘Display all categories’ is enabled, then all articles are listed. Uncheck the option to get the possibility of selecting categories.

data.name: lblEnableGalleryIntegration.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then EasyDNNgallery is integrated to the EasyDNNnews module. Advanced options of displaying galleries within articles and managing images will be available.

data.name: lblFilterPostsbyAuthor.HelpText
data.value: Select authors whose articles will be displayed. If the option 'Display from all authors' is enabled, then all articles from all authors will be displayed. Uncheck the option to get the possibility of selecting authors.

data.name: lblGalleryDisplayType.HelpText
data.value: Select one of the offered gallery types. The selected gallery type will be displayed in the articles.

data.name: lblGalleryHeight.HelpText
data.value: Enter a height of images in galleries in articles.

data.name: lblGalleryItemsPerPage.HelpText
data.value: Set a maximum number of items per page.

data.name: lblGalleryNumberOfColumns.HelpText
data.value: Set a number of columns where items will be displayed.

data.name: lblGalleryPosition.HelpText
data.value: Select the gallery position in relation to article content. Bottom position means that the gallery will be displayed below article content, whereas Top position means that the gallery will be displayed above article content.

data.name: lblGalleryThumbHeight.HelpText
data.value: Enter a height of a thumbnail images of galleries in articles.

data.name: lblGalleryThumbWidth.HelpText
data.value: Enter a width of a thumbnail images of galleries in articles.

data.name: lblGalleryWidth.HelpText
data.value: Enter a width of images in galleries in articles.

data.name: lblGIDisplayItemDescription.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, a description will be displayed with each item.

data.name: lblGIDisplayItemDescriptionLightBox.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, a description will be displayed with each item in a lightbox.

data.name: lblGIDisplayItemTitle.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, a title will be displayed with each item.

data.name: lblGIDisplayItemTitleLightBOx.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, a title will be displayed with each item in a lightbox.

data.name: lblGlobalQuery.HelpText
data.value: This module receives global query string that may be set in another article.

data.name: lblGlobalQuery.Text
data.value: Enable opening article links from another instance:

data.name: lblImageReize.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, uploaded images will be resized.

data.name: lblImageReizeHeight.HelpText
data.value: Enter a maximum height in pixels to which images will be resized. Images with smaller dimensions will not be increased.

data.name: lblImageReizeWidth.HelpText
data.value: Enter a maximum width in pixels to which images will be resized. Images with smaller dimensions will not be increased.

data.name: lblImageThmbHeight.HelpText
data.value: Set a height of a thumbnail for an article list. The thumbnail is generated from an image which is set as the main article image.

data.name: lblImageThmbWidth.HelpText
data.value: Set a width of a thumbnail for an article list. The thumbnail is generated from an image which is set as the main article image.

data.name: lblJpegQuality.HelpText
data.value: Set a quality of images. Higher value means higher quality. Values have to be between 1 and 100.

data.name: lblMainImageHeight.HelpText
data.value: Set a height of the main article image. The main article image is an introduction image for article details.

data.name: lblMainImageWidth.HelpText
data.value: Set a width of the main article image. The main article image is an introduction image for article details.

data.name: lblModuleToCat.HelpText
data.value: Only articles from the selected categories will be displayed.

data.name: lblModuleToCat.Text
data.value: Display articles only from this category:

data.name: lblNumberOfPostsToDisplayLab.HelpText
data.value: Enter the number of the article that tops the list. Default value is 1, which means that listing begins with the first article present. If value is 5, that means that listing will start with the fifth article from the list, whereas articles above will not be listed. The list of articles can be managed in Settings at 4. Filter articles.

data.name: lblOpenCategoryFirstArticle.HelpText
data.value: If this option is selected, details from the first article in the category are opened, if the link contains a CategoryID parameter.

data.name: lblOpenCategoryFirstArticle.Text
data.value: Open details of first article in category:

data.name: lblOpenFirstArticle.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, the first article's details will be opened.

data.name: lblOpenFirstArticleByDate.HelpText
data.value: If this option is selected, details from the first article in the category are opened if the link contains a Date parameter.

data.name: lblOpenFirstArticleByDate.Text
data.value: Open details of first article by date:

data.name: lblOpenFirstByDateMorethanone.HelpText
data.value: If this option is selected, details from the first article in the category are opened, provided it is the only article of that date and if the link contains a Date parameter. In case there are multiple articles of the same date, the list of articles will be displayed.

data.name: lblOpenFirstByDateMorethanone.Text
data.value: Open first article by date if there is only one article:

data.name: lblOpenFirstKatMOreThanOne.HelpText
data.value: If this option is selected, details from the first article in the category are opened, if it is the only article in the category and the link contains a CategoryID parameter. If there are multiple articles in the category, the list of articles will be displayed.

data.name: lblOpenFirstKatMOreThanOne.Text
data.value: Open first article in category if there is only one article:

data.name: lblOpenInaPage.HelpText
data.value: Upon clicking on links within an article (categories, tags and authors), links will be opened by default in the same instance that the article is displayed or opened in. By using this option you can set the links to be opened at another page where the news module is present. In that news module, the option "Open article links in another instance" should be switched on.

data.name: lblOpenInaPage.Text
data.value: Open article links in another page:

data.name: lblPassCategoryID.HelpText
data.value: If this option is switched on, CategoryID and Category name parameter is forwarded in the article's link. This allows for the satellite modules to receive information regarding the article's category. It is used with Category menu module, Tag Cloud module, Search module (Advanced search) and EasyDNNrotator module.

data.name: lblPassCategoryID.Text
data.value: Pass CategoryID and Category name query string in article URL:

data.name: lblPostOrder.HelpText
data.value: Select a criteria by which articles will be listed, including Descending and Ascending.

data.name: lblShowOnlyEventsLimit.HelpText
data.value: Set the criteria to display events whose start date has ended. The option 'Show all' will display all events, disregarding the fact that they have already ended. We can enter the number of days to be set in the past for past events in the field 'Limit to number of days in the past'. If the set value is 0, the criterion for the event's listing will be the current date. In that case, neither of the past events will be displayed.

data.name: lblShowOnlyFeatured.HelpText
data.value: The option 'Show only featured articles' allows only the articles marked as featured to be displayed.

data.name: lblShrinkImagesProportionaly.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, the main article image will be proportionally resized.

data.name: lblShrinkImagesProportionalyOpt.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, the main article image will be resized and cropped.

data.name: lblThemeChangeing.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then authors can change a theme of article details.

data.name: lblTokenCSSClass.HelpText
data.value: Select a position for an image in relation to text.

data.name: lblTokenDescription.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then the option image description will be enabled by default in the token editor.

data.name: lblTokenEmbedLightBox.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then the option for opening items in a lightbox will be enabled by default in the token editor.

data.name: lblTokenHeight.HelpText
data.value: Set a default height value which will be set for an image in the token editor.

data.name: lblTokenResizeCrop.HelpText
data.value: Select a resize method for images.

data.name: lblTokenTitle.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then the option image title will be enabled by default in the token editor.

data.name: lblTokenWidth.HelpText
data.value: Set a default width value which will be set for an image in the token editor.

data.name: lblUseGalleryDefault.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, settings set here, in the module's settings, will be applied across all articles. If this option is not selected, it is possible to select a different type of gallery while adding each individual article.

data.name: lblUseGalleryDefault.Text
data.value: Force default settings on all articles:

data.name: lblUserCanSeeOnlyHisGalleries.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, users can only manage those galleries they have added to articles. Other users' galleries are not available to them.

data.name: lblUserCanSeeOnlyHisGalleries.Text
data.value: Users can only manage their own galleries:

data.name: lblUserCanSeeOnlyHisImages.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, users can only manage those images in a Shared gallery they have added. Other users' images are not available to them.

data.name: lblUserCanSeeOnlyHisImages.Text
data.value: Users can only manage their own images:

data.name: lblAddLinkToOriginalRSS.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, imported RSS articles will contain links to original articles.

data.name: lblAllowArticleComments.HelpText
data.value: Enable turning off comments per article.

data.name: lblAllowArticleComments.Text
data.value: Enable turning off comments per article:

data.name: lblAuthorCanEditTheirOwnGroup.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, authors can edit their own group profile.

data.name: lblAuthorCanEditTheirOwnGroup.Text
data.value: Authors can edit their group profile:

data.name: lblAuthorcCanEditProfile.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, authors can edit their own profile.

data.name: lblCharaterReplace.HelpText
data.value: A list of characters that will be replaced in article lists. Article links are generated from article titles. Sometimes a title can contain characters which are not desirable in links, so you can set a replacement character. The following characters are automatically removed: :.&%$#.

data.name: lblCharaterReplace.Text
data.value: List of replaced characters in article links:

data.name: lblDisqusID.HelpText
data.value: Enter the DISQUS id of the site. Your site(forum) shortname as registered on Disqus.

data.name: lblDisqusOnLine.HelpText
data.value: Use this option if your site is not online (e.g. secured staging server or a local environment).

data.name: lblEnableCAPTCA.HelpText
data.value: Use Google Recaptcha when adding comments. You also need to enter Google Recaptcha keys in API CONNECTION control.

data.name: lblEnablePaidContent.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then it is possible to use the paid content functionality. This functionality enables displaying article parts only to users in selected security roles.

data.name: lblEnableRelatedArticles.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled then related articles will be displayed in articles. Articles are considered to be related if they have the same tag or tags.

data.name: lblFacebookID.HelpText
data.value: Enter Facebook APP ID. If you are getting comments via Facebook USER ID, leave None in this field.

data.name: lblFacebookNumberOfComents.HelpText
data.value: Enter number of Facebook comments per page.

data.name: lblFacebookUserID.HelpText
data.value: Enter Facebook USER ID. If you are getting comments via Facebook APP ID, leave None in this field.

data.name: lblGOogleAPIKey.HelpText
data.value: Here you can add a Google Maps API key. After that, it is possible to use the built-in Google maps editor in the Add-Edit Article Form.

data.name: lblImportetRSSAsLink.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, RSS links will open original articles.

data.name: lblLimitArticle.HelpText
data.value: Limit the article body display to a desired number of characters. For a precise article cropping after a desired number of characters, the HTML formatting will be removed from an article. If the value is 0 then there is no limit.

data.name: lblLimitSubtitle.HelpText
data.value: Limit subtitle display to a desired number of characters. If the value is 0 there is no limit.

data.name: lblLimitSummary.HelpText
data.value: Limit the summary display to a desired number of characters. For a precise article cropping after a desired number of characters, the HTML formatting will be removed from an article. If the value is 0 then there is no limit.

data.name: lblLimitTitle.HelpText
data.value: Limit the title display to a desired number of characters. If the value is 0 then there is no limit.

data.name: lblNumberOfReleatedArticles.HelpText
data.value: Set a number of related articles which will be displayed.

data.name: lblOpenRssLinksInNewWindow.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, original articles will be opened in new browser windows.

data.name: lblOpenRssLinksInNewWindow.Text
data.value: Open RSS links in new window:

data.name: lblPaidContentShowComments.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then comments will be visible also to users in security roles who do not have the right to see the paid content.

data.name: lblPaidContentShowImageGallery.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then image galleries in articles will be visible to users in security roles who do not have the right to see the paid content.

data.name: lblPaidContentShowImageGallery.Text
data.value: Show image gallery to non-paid visitors:

data.name: lblRSSInsertImage.HelpText
data.value: If this option is included, the main article image will be included in the RSS item description.

data.name: lblRSSInsertImage.Text
data.value: Include main article image in RSS item description:

data.name: lblRSSLinkBack.HelpText
data.value: Here you can enter a RSS backlink. A RSS backlink is displayed in the RSS header and it is usually a link to your website.

data.name: lblRSSShowImages.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, the main article image will be included in the RSS.

data.name: lblRSSShowImages.Text
data.value: Include main article image in RSS:

data.name: lblShowAuthorsBox.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, the author’s profile is displayed in an article.

data.name: lblShowAuthorsGroupBox.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then an article displays a profile of a group of authors to which author belongs. A group profile is displayed only if an author belongs to some group of authors.

data.name: lblShowCommentsRAting.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then it is possible to rate comments.

data.name: lblShowThreaedComments.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, comments will be displayed in the threaded mode.

data.name: cvAuthorsTreeview.ErrorMessage
data.value: Please select at least one author.

data.name: cvCategoriesTreeview.ErrorMessage
data.value: Please select at least one category.

data.name: lblFixedResponsiveLayout.HelpText
data.value: Choose between fixed and responsive layout. Your choice depends on whether your DNN skin is responsive or not.

data.name: lblRSSNumberOfArticles.HelpText
data.value: Here you can set how many articles will be included in the RSS feed. The sorting criteria is a publish date.

data.name: lblRSSNumberOfCharactersInRSS.HelpText
data.value: Here you can enter a number of characters to which you want to limit the length of a RSS feed item description. If the set value is 0, then there is no limit.

data.name: lblRSSNumberOfCharactersInRSS.Text
data.value: Limit RSS feed item description to characters:

data.name: lblFeaturedOnTop.HelpText
data.value: The option 'Keep featured articles on top' allows for all the featured articles to be displayed before all other articles, disregarding "Order articles by" option.

data.name: hlToAppiConnection.Text
data.value: To enable Twitter integration please setup Twitter app

data.name: lblArticleSiteMap.HelpText
data.value: Here is a link to articles sitemaps.

data.name: lblCommentTojournal.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, comments on articles will be published on the Journal.

data.name: lblConToTwitterError.Text
data.value: Error while connecting to Twitter. Please check your Internet connection and your Twitter app consumer key and secret.

data.name: lblEnableJournal.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, an author can optionally publish article on the DNN Journal.

data.name: lblEnableJournal.Text
data.value: Enable posting of articles to Journal:

data.name: lblEnableTwitter.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, authors can automatically publish an article on Twitter when publishing an article.

data.name: lblEnterTwitterPIN.Text
data.value: Enter security code provided by Twitter:

data.name: lblGroupActivityModule.HelpText
data.value: Select an instance of the main news module in which article details published on the Journal of a social group will be opened.

data.name: lblGroupActivityModule.Text
data.value: Open article details from group’s journal in module instance:

data.name: lblIsSocialInstance.HelpText
data.value: Displays user's and group's articles on the Activity feed. The articles are filtered by the UserID or GroupID querystring. If this option is enabled and the querystring UserID or GroupID is missing, then the articles won't show up.

data.name: lblJournaPostingInfo.Text
data.value: Select which article elements post to Journal:

data.name: lblNoSocialSharing.Text
data.value: This functionality is only available in DotNetNuke version 6.2 or higher.

data.name: lblSelectCommentsAvatarSource.HelpText
data.value: Select an avatar source which will be displayed with an author's name. It is possible to select the Gravatar service that displays an author's avatar according to their email address, if an author has a gravatar. The second option is using images from a DNN user profile.

data.name: lblTwitterDetails.HelpText
data.value: Select an instance of the main news module in which article details from links on Twitter will be opened.

data.name: lblTwitterDetails.Text
data.value: Open articles from Twitter in module instance:

data.name: lblTwitterSetup.Text
data.value: To connect to Twitter you need to:<br/>1.Click on link "Connect module to Twitter account". New window will open and you need to login to Twitter and give your Twitter app to connect to your account<br /> 2. Copy the security code that Twitter will provide into field below. <br/&gt3. Click on Connect to Twitter button.

data.name: lblUserActivityModule.HelpText
data.value: Select an instance of the main news module in which article details published on a user’s journal will be opened.

data.name: lblUserActivityModule.Text
data.value: Open article details from user’s journal in module instance:

data.name: lblRSSShowLink.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, an icon of the RSS feed will be displayed in an article list. An icon is usually placed at the bottom of a list and its template depends on the position in a HTML template.

data.name: lblRSSShowLink.Text
data.value: Show RSS icon in article list:

data.name: lblEnableRSSResource1.HelpText
data.value: Link to a RSS feed of the current module instance.

data.name: lblFeaturedArticles.HelpText
data.value: The option 'Show only featured articles' allows only the articles marked as featured to be displayed. The option 'Keep featured articles on top' allows for all the featured articles to be displayed before all other articles, disregarding the publish date.

data.name: AutopostingtoJournal.Text
data.value: Autoposting to Journal and Social networks

data.name: hlToAppiConnectionFB.Text
data.value: To enable Facebook integration please setup Facebook app

data.name: hlVisitDetailInstrictionsFacebook.Text
data.value: For more detail instructions please visit this link.

data.name: lblConToFacebookError.Text
data.value: Error while connecting to Facebook. Please check your Internet connection and your Facebook app consumer key and secret.

data.name: lblFacebookSetup.Text
data.value: To connect to Facebook you need to:<br/>1.Click on link "Connect to Facebook account". New window will open and you need to login to Facebook and give your Facebbok app to connect to your account<br /> 2. Click on button Connect to Facebook. After connected select from the dropdown list where you will post on Facebook.

data.name: lblOpenFacebookDetails.HelpText
data.value: Select an instance of the main news module in which article details from links on Facebook will be opened.

data.name: lblOpenFacebookDetails.Text
data.value: Open articles from Facebook in module instance:

data.name: lblSelectFBPostTo.Text
data.value: Select where to post on Facebook:

data.name: lblMapsUserLocationRequest.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, authors will be asked to share their location while adding an article.

data.name: lblMapsUserLocationRequest.Text
data.value: Ask authors to share their location when adding articles:

data.name: lblAuthorAlias.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, it is possible to change an author alias in articles.

data.name: lblAuthorAlias.Text
data.value: Enable adding author name alias per article:

data.name: lblRSSDetailsData.HelpText
data.value: Here you can select from which article element a RSS item description will be generated. Possible choices are Article content (body) and Article summary. If you don’t want for a RSS item to have a description, select the option No description.

data.name: UserIDInLink.HelpText
data.value: If this option is switched on, the userID parameter will be forwarded in the article's link. This option is used within a DNN user profile to display the user's articles.

data.name: UserIDInLink.Text
data.value: Pass userID querystring in article link:

data.name: lblCategoryIDForFilterByArticle.HelpText
data.value: Selected category will filter articles list in grid view.

data.name: lblDynamicModuleConatinerTitle.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, the container title is created according to a selected category, tag, author, or searched term.

data.name: lblFilterByTags.HelpText
data.value: This option the selection of tags by which articles will be displayed. For instance, if we select tags 'cars' and 'trucks', only those articles that contain tags 'cars' and 'trucks' will be displayed.

data.name: lblHideUnlocalizedItems.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, articles will not be displayed in the language that translation has not been added for. Example: There is a DNN site with three languages: English (default), German and Italian. The article in English has been added its Italian translation. When we select German, the list of articles in German will not feature the article to which its German translation hasn't been added. Only those articles that have been translated to German will be featured. If this option hasn't been switched on, and there is no translation for a certain language, the article will be displayed in its default language. Note: Articles are always added in their default language, but displaying articles in their default language can also be switched off. This can be done in Add/edit form, that is, in the article's translation interface it is necessary to choose "Do not show article in default language".

data.name: lblHideUnlocalizedItems.Text
data.value: Do not display articles without translation for a selected language:

data.name: lblPortalSharing.HelpText
data.value: This option allows for displaying of articles from other portals. Here you can select one or more portals from where articles will be displayed. In order to be able to receive articles from other portals, sharing of articles must be enabled in the portal that shares articles with this portal. Configure sharing of articles in Dashboard > Cross portal sharing.

data.name: OlderversionofEasyDNNgalleryinstalled.Text
data.value: Older version of EasyDNNgallery installed. Please upgrade to version 6.2.0 or higher to enable integration.

data.name: PleaseaddEasyDNNgalley.Text
data.value: Please add EasyDNNgallery instance to some page or DEMO has expired.

data.name: Thatuserisadminorsuperuser.Text
data.value: That user is admin or superuser.

data.name: lblGoogleNewsArticleSiteMap.Help
data.value: Here is a link to Google news articles sitemaps.

data.name: lblExpireDateDaysToAdd.HelpText
data.value: Number of days to add to expire date in add form.

data.name: lblExpireDateDaysToAdd.Text
data.value: Number of days to add to expire date:

data.name: lblCFEnableGroupSelection.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, authors will be enabled to select a custom fields group when adding and editing articles.

data.name: lblCFSelectedGroup.HelpText
data.value: Select a default custom fields group. The selected group's fields will be displayed by default when adding or editing articles. If Enable selecting custom fields group is disabled when adding or editing articles, it will only be possible to enter values to a single group selected here. If no group has been selected, the default value will be "Default – first group by position". This refers to the group's position in Custom fields group manager.

data.name: lblCFUserSelectionType.HelpText
data.value: Set the range of custom fields management given to authors of articles when adding or editing an article. An author can enable custom fields within an article. If this option is selected, an author can enable custom fields within an article when adding or editing it. Custom fields are not enabled by default when adding or editing an article, but they can be enabled by the author. The author can disable custom fields within an article. If this option is selected, the author can disable custom fields within an article. Custom fields are enabled by default when adding or editing an article, but they can be disabled by author. Author can't disable custom fields within an article. If this option is selected, author can't disable custom fields within an article. Custom fields are enabled by default within an article, and author can't switch them off when adding it.

data.name: lblExpireDateDaysToAdd.HelpText1
data.value: Number of days to add to expire date in add form.

data.name: lblExpireDateDaysToAdd.Text1
data.value: Number of days to add to expire date:

data.name: lblExpirehDateSettings.HelpText
data.value: Here you can adjust the default expire date for articles. Important: after the expire date, articles are not displayed anymore.

data.name: lblPublishDateSettings.HelpText
data.value: Here you set a value for publish date which will be set by default in Add-Edit Article form.

data.name: liCFUserSelectionType0.Text
data.value: Author can enable custom fields within an article

data.name: liCFUserSelectionType1.Text
data.value: Author can disable custom fields within an article

data.name: liCFUserSelectionType2.Text
data.value: Author can't disable custom fields within an article

data.name: PublishDateExpireDate.Text
data.value: Expire date must be greater than publish date!

data.name: lblLightboxGalleryResizeMethod.HelpText
data.value: Select a resize method for images.

data.name: liCropAndPropotional.Text
data.value: Resize and crop horizontal, proportionally resize vertical images

data.name: lblCategoriesSelectionExpanded.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then the tree of categories in Add-Edit Article Form will be expanded.

data.name: lblChameleonResponsiveMainImageWidth.HelpText
data.value: Enter a width of the main article image.

data.name: lblEventsAddEditFormDefault.HelpText
data.value: Here you can set possibilities for an author to add events.

data.name: liEventsAddEditFormDefault0.Text
data.value: User can enable adding article as event

data.name: liEventsAddEditFormDefault1.Text
data.value: User can disable adding article as event

data.name: liEventsAddEditFormDefault2.Text
data.value: User can't disable adding article as event

data.name: lblPaginationType.HelpText
data.value: Select a pagination type. The classical pagination shares the list of articles into multiple pages for "paged" navigation. The infinite scroll pagination with the Load more button loads a set of articles, which requires each new set of articles to be clicked on via the Load more button at the bottom of the page. The infinite scroll pagination with automatic article loading automatically loads a new set of articles when a user scrolls down to the bottom of the page.

data.name: rblPaginationTypeButton.Text
data.value: Infinite scroll pagination with Load more button

data.name: rblPaginationTypeButtonAndScroll.Text
data.value: Infinite scroll pagination with automatic article loading

data.name: lblEnableFacebook.Help
data.value: If this option is enabled, authors can automatically publish an article on Facebook when publishing an article.

data.name: lblCFShowOnlyFilledItems.HelpText
data.value: This option is related to displaying of custom fields in articles. If this option is enabled, only custom fields containing some value will be displayed. If this option is not enabled, custom fields without values will also be displayed.

data.name: lblCFShowOnlyFilledItems.Text
data.value: Show only custom fields containing values:

data.name: lblShowCommentsFromAllPortals.Help
data.value: If this option is enabled, comments on articles from all portals will be displayed. It is used by the Cross portal sharing option.

data.name: lblDisplayingMethod.HelpText
data.value: 'Apply filters' - This option allows for article filtering. 'Select specific articles' - This option allows for manual selection of articles that need to be displayed. If this option is enabled, only the selected articles are displayed.

data.name: lblSelectArticleEvents.HelpText
data.value: This option allows for displaying articles only, or events only, or both.

data.name: lblStripRSSHtml.Help
data.value: If this option is enabled then it will remove the HTML formatting which exists in articles and the RSS item description will be a plain text.

data.name: lblStripRSSHtml.Text
data.value: Remove HTML formatting from articles in RSS:

data.name: lblAutomaticallyDisplayGalleryInArticle.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, after uploading images, displaying of a gallery in articles will be enabled by default.

data.name: lblAutomaticallyDisplayGalleryInArticle.Text
data.value: Automatically set displaying of gallery in articles:

data.name: lblAutomaticallySetMainArticleImage.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, after uploading images, the first image will be automatically set as the main article image.

data.name: lblCropResizeMode.Help
data.value: Choose a central point for cropping images.

data.name: lblArticleListDisplayStyle.HelpText
data.value: Select a display style for the selected theme.

data.name: lblArticleListTheme.HelpText
data.value: Select a theme for an article list.

data.name: lblDetailsDocumentsTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template for the documents section. The documents section is a part of an article list or details which is used for displaying documents which are added in an article with a help of Document option in Add-Edit Article Form. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblDetailsLinksTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template for the links section. The links section is a part of an article list or details which is used for displaying documents which are added in an article with a help of Links option in Add-Edit Article Form. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblDetailsRelatedArticlesTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template for the related articles section. The related articles section is a part of an article list or details which displays related articles. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblListDocumentsTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template for the documents section. The documents section is a part of an article list or details which is used for displaying documents which are added in an article with the Documents option in Add-Edit Article Form. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblListLinksTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template for the links section. The links section is a part of an article list or details which is used for displaying documents which are added in an article with Links option in Add-Edit Article Form. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblListRelatedArticlesTemplate.HelpText
data.value: Select a HTML template for the related articles section. The related articles section is a part of an article list or details which displays related articles. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblClearSearchIndexer.HelpText
data.value: Clears already indexed articles. Run this if you need to index all content again.

data.name: lblRestrictionByDateRange.HelpText
data.value: Here you can enter a number of days in the past from which articles will be displayed.

data.name: AdminFuturePostsVisible.HelpText
data.value: Display all articles on all lists (also articles with a publish date in the future), only when logged in as an admin.

data.name: AdminFuturePostsVisible.Text
data.value: Display articles with publish date in future:

data.name: liNumberOfDaysFromCurrentDate.Text
data.value: Number of days from current date

data.name: lblGalleryCategory.HelpText
data.value: Select a category in EasyDNNgallery in which galleries added to articles will be saved.

data.name: lblGetAlreadyIndexedContent.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, then the DNN Search Crawler will take all the articles in the consideration during indexing of content. If this option is disabled, then all the index articles will be marked as indexed and the next time they won’t be taken in the consideration, unless there were some changes in an article.

data.name: lblGravityGalleryThumbnailWidth.Help
data.value: Enter a width of a thumbnail images of galleries in articles.

data.name: lblGravityGalleryItemsPerPage.Help
data.value: Set a maximum number of items per page.

data.name: lblGravityGalleryEnablePagination.Help
data.value: If this option is enabled, it displays pagination after reaching a maximum number of items per page.

data.name: lblGravityGalleryResizeMethod.Help
data.value: Select a method of resizing images.

data.name: lblShowLinkToGravityGallery.Help
data.value: If this option is enabled, in a gallery within an article a link will be added that opens gallery in the EasyDNNgallery module – only the gravity gallery. A gallery in the EasyDNNgallery module can have a link back on an article.

data.name: lblGravityGalleryThumbnailHeight.Help
data.value: Enter a height of a thumbnail images of galleries in articles.

data.name: lbllGravityGalleryInstances.Help
data.value: Select Gravity gallery module for full gallery view.

data.name: lblCanonicalURLs.Help
data.value: If this option is enabled, a canonical link element is added to articles in this instance. This option is used if you want to avoid the possible negative impact of duplicated content on SEO. If you display articles in more different module instances on site, it is desirable to disable this option on one module instance. The option is enabled on the instance where article details are displayed.

data.name: lblClearSearchIndexerAll.Text
data.value: Clear already indexed articles on all portals:

data.name: lblClearSearchIndexerAll.HelpText
data.value: Clears already indexed articles. Run this if you need to index all content again.

data.name: lblChameleonOpenDetailsInGravityGallery.Text
data.value: Open media details in Gravity gallery:

data.name: lblChameleonOpenDetailsInGravityGallery.Help
data.value: Turn on this option to open media details in Gravity gallery. If you turn on this option you also need to select 'Open details in Gravity gallery' option from lightbox type selection.

data.name: lblChameleonGravityGalleryInstances.Help
data.value: Select Gravity gallery module for full gallery view.

data.name: lblFilterByCustomFields.HelpText
data.value: This option enables filtering of articles based on the values stored in the custom fields. It is necessary to select a custom fields group, choose a custom field from it and click on the Add button. After that, it is possible to define the filtering rules. It is possible to choose more custom fields for filtering articles.

data.name: lblFilterRelatedArticles.HelpKey
data.value: By module categories - Related articles are displayed by the filter set in the module instance where you can open article details. By article categories - Related articles are filtrated by categories in which an article is added. Show related articles from all categories - Related articles aren't filtrated by any categories.

data.name: lblCategoryInArticleLink.HelpText
data.value: If this option is enabled, a category will be added to article links. If an article is added in more categories, the last category in a row will be added. This option does not have any influence on the catalog mode while there is already CategoryID and Category name in a link by default.

data.name: lblCategoryInArticleLink.Text
data.value: Include CategoryID and Category name querystring in article link:

data.name: MaximumNumberOfImagesPerArticle.Text
data.value: Max. number of images per article

data.name: MaximumNumberOfVideosPerArticle.Text
data.value: Max. number of videos per article

data.name: MaximumNumberOfAudiosPerArticle.Text
data.value: Max. number of audios per article

data.name: MaximumNumberOfDocumentsPerArticle.Text
data.value: Max. number of documents per article

data.name: MaximumNumberOfLinksPerArticle.Text
data.value: Max. number of links per article

data.name: MaximumNumberOfTagsPerArticle.Text
data.value: Max. number of tags per article

data.name: MaximumNumberOfCategoriesPerArticle.Text
data.value: Max. number of categories per article

data.name: lblGravityGallerySelectTemplate.Help
data.value: Select a HTML template for the gravity gallery. This template will be used if the gravity gallery is used for displaying galleries within articles. HTML templates can be edited in the template editor (Dashboard > Templates).

data.name: lblUsernameToAddResource1.Help
data.value: Add a user and set individual permissions for him or her. Permissions are added to existing permissions, meaning, if a user has some security role to which some permissions are added, it is not possible to take away these permissions, but just to add them some additional ones.

data.name: lblReplaceDNNTokens.Help
data.value: Replace standard DNN tokens with the appropriate environment values.

data.name: lblArticleDetailsImageResizeMethod.HelpKey
data.value: Select article details main image resize method.

data.name: lblArticleDetailsImageResizeMethod.Text
data.value: Article details main image resize method:

data.name: lblArticleListImageResizeMethod.HelpKey
data.value: Select article list thumbnail resize method.

data.name: lblCCEmailsForAuthors.Help
data.value: While contacting an article author through a contact form, send CC to a specified address.

data.name: lblJournaPostingInfo.Help
data.value: Select which article element will be published on Journal.

data.name: lblRSSNumberOfArticles.Text
data.value: Number of articles in RSS feed:

data.name: lblSelectFBPostTo.Help
data.value: Select a Facebook page or profile where articles will be published.

data.name: lblContactEmailByArticle.Help
data.value: This option enables adding of a custom contact email address by articles. When contacting an author by using the contact form, the email address added here is used. If an email hasn’t been added, the main author's email is used for sending. A custom email can be entered in the Advanced panel of the Add-edit article form.

data.name: lblDisplayMainArticleImageInGallery.Help
data.value: This option enables the image that has been selected as the Main article image, not to display among a gallery of images. After an image is selected as the Main article image, it is no longer visible among other images in the gallery.

data.name: lblDisplayMainArticleImageInGallery.Text
data.value: Don't display the Main article image in the gallery:

data.value: Editor for Summary and Content field.

data.value: Editor for Summary and Content field:

data.value: Maximum number of characters allowed in summary.

data.value: Maximum number of characters allowed in summary:

data.value: Display Control bar in article details.

data.value: Display Control bar in article list. Display Control bar in article details.

data.value: Maximum number of characters allowed in article.

data.name: hlLinkedInApiConnection.Text
data.value: To enable Linkedin integration please setup LinkedIn app

data.name: lblEnableLinkedIn.Help
data.value: Enable posting to LinkedIn social network.

data.name: lblOpenLinkedInDetails.Text
data.value: Select module to open news details from LinkedIn links:

data.name: lblOpenLinkedInDetails.Help
data.value: Select news module instance to open news details from LinkedIn links.

data.name: lblLinkedInSetup.Text
data.value: To connect to LinkedIn you need to:<br/>1.Click on link "Connect to LinkedIn account". New window will open and you need to login to LinkedIn and give your LinkedIn app permission to connect to your account<br /> 2. Click on button Connect to LinkedIn. After connected select from the dropdown list where you will post on LinkedIn.

data.name: lblLinkedInWhereToPost.Text
data.value: Select where to post on LinkedIn:

data.name: LinkedInDataRecivied.Text
data.value: LinkedIn data received. Connected to LinkedIn.

data.name: InfoDisableEventsIfNotInUse.Text
data.value: Additionally improve the loading performance by disabling displaying of events in section "4. Filtering options" if you don't use the event functionality.

data.name: lblContentSelection.Help
data.value: The module allows for setting up viewing permissions per article and the general viewing permissions for all articles. The permissions per article can be set in every article and the general viewing permissions can be set here in the settings under the section 1. Permissions. If your site does not use permissions (all articles are visible to all users) then you can disable these options here and improve the performance of loading articles. Important: if you disable using of the permissions here, even if you set them up they will be ignored by the module.

data.name: lblContactFormEnableCaptcha.Help
data.value: Use Google Recaptcha on contact form. You also need to enter Google Recaptcha keys in API CONNECTION control.

data.name: FilterByArticlesOpenArticleDetails.Help
data.value: Open details if only one article.

data.name: FilterByArticlesOpenArticleDetails.Text
data.value: Open details if only one article:

data.name: lblOpenArticleLinkInListMode.Help
data.value: Article from link is openned as first in list.

data.name: lblOpenArticleLinkInListMode.Text
